statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fordham 78, Pennsylvania 63
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Jermaine Anderson scored a season-high 25 points and Fordham shot 67 percent from the field in the second half in a 78-63 victory over Penn on Monday night. Anderson, who came into the game leading the Rams (6-9) in scoring at 16.1 points per game, made all five of his shots in the second half and was 9-for-13 for the game. Fordham, which won for the third time in four games, finished 27-for-50 for the game (54 percent), 16-for-24 in the second half. Bryant Dunston added 20 points and 12 rebounds for the Rams, while Michael Binns had 12 points and eight rebounds. Fordham finished with a 39-28 advantage on the boards. Ibrahim Jaaber had 18 points for Penn (6-5), which won the first three games of its four-game trip. The Quakers open Ivy League play on Friday against Cornell. Mark Zoller, who had 17 points and 12 rebounds, scored on an offensive rebound with 16:23 to play to give Penn a 43-39 lead. That would be the last field goal generated by Penn's offense for almost 10 minutes. Fordham went on a 12-0 run to go ahead 51-43 with 12:08 left on a 3-pointer by Corey McCrae, who finished with 12 points. Penn scored two baskets off steals to get to 51-47 with 10:54 left, but Anderson scored the game's next six points and Fordham had its first double-digit lead, 57-47 with 8:24 to go. Penn, which was 5-for-23 from 3-point range, never got closer than nine points the rest of the way and the Rams led by as many as 17. Anderson, who had six assists, had scored 21 points twice this season and the senior guard's career high was 29 points last season against St. Bonaventure.
